webhooks.title: Webhooks
webhooks.description: Configure webhooks to sync member data with external applications
webhooks.createDescription: Configure webhook to receive member data updates
webhooks.name: Webhook Name
webhooks.secretKeyHint: Minimum 16 characters. Used for HMAC signature verification.
webhooks.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this webhook?
webhooks.apiInfoDesc: Share these API endpoints with your external application developers
webhooks.externalAppInstructions: Use these endpoints to pull member data. See documentation in /app/docs/EXTERNAL_API.md for complete integration guide.
webhooks.configurationsDesc: Configure webhooks to push member data to external applications
webhooks.apiCredentialsDesc: Use these credentials for API polling/sync (alternative to webhooks)
webhooks.usernameNote: Use this username for API authentication. This is a system account, not a personal email.
webhooks.credentialsNote: Currently using standard authentication. For production, create a dedicated API user account (e.g., api_external@church.com) or contact support for API key generation.

apiKeys.title: API Keys for External Apps
apiKeys.description: Generate secure API keys for system-to-system integration
apiKeys.noKeysHint: Click 'Generate New API Key' to create credentials for external applications
apiKeys.keyHidden: Hidden for security. Regenerate to get a new key.
apiKeys.copyNow: ⚠️ Copy this key now! It won't be shown again.
apiKeys.saveWarning: Save these credentials securely. The API key will not be displayed again after closing this dialog.
apiKeys.newKeyWarning: IMPORTANT: Copy these credentials now. The API key will not be shown again!
apiKeys.confirmRegenerate: Regenerate API key? The old key will stop working immediately.
apiKeys.confirmDelete: Delete this API key? External apps using it will lose access.
apiKeys.securityWarning: API keys have full admin access to your church data. Keep them secure and rotate regularly.

event.eventDateRequired: Event date is required for single events

importExport.title: Import/Export
importExport.subtitle: Bulk import and export member data
importExport.subtitleUnified: Import members with data, photos, and documents in one unified process
importExport.uploadFileDesc: Select a CSV or JSON file to import
importExport.uploadFileDescSQL: Select a CSV, JSON, or SQL file to import
importExport.dragDrop: Drag and drop a file here, or click to browse
importExport.csvDesc: Comma-separated values with headers in first row
importExport.jsonDesc: Array of objects with consistent fields
importExport.mapFieldsDesc: Match your file columns to member fields
importExport.enterDefault: Enter default value for all records...
importExport.mapRequiredFields: Please map all required fields: First Name, Last Name, WhatsApp Number
importExport.mapBasicRequiredFields: Please map all required fields: Full Name, Gender, Birth Date, Address
importExport.mapOnlyFullName: Please map the required field: Full Name
importExport.dateFormatRequired: Date format required (as per church setting):
importExport.mapValuesDesc: Transform values to match system format
importExport.noMappableFields: No fields that need value mapping
importExport.allRecordsValid: All records are valid and ready to import!
importExport.fixErrorsBeforeImport: Please fix the errors before importing
importExport.reviewAndConfirm: Review the summary and confirm to proceed
importExport.importWarning: This action will add new members to your database. Make sure all data is correct.
importExport.pleaseDoNotClose: Please do not close this window
importExport.exportDataDesc: Download member data in CSV or JSON format
importExport.uploadPhotosDesc: Bulk upload profile photos and match to members
importExport.uploadDocumentsDesc: Bulk upload personal documents and match to members
importExport.supportedPhotoFormats: Archive: ZIP, RAR | Photos: JPG, JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP, WEBP
importExport.supportedDocumentFormats: Archive: ZIP, RAR | Documents: PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, JPG, PNG
importExport.photoStep1: Import members with photo_filename field in CSV
importExport.photoStep2: Prepare photos with exact matching filenames
importExport.photoStep3: Create ZIP/RAR archive with all photos
importExport.photoStep4: Upload here - photos auto-match to members
importExport.photoStepNew1: Photo filenames were mapped in Step 2 (Field Mapping)
importExport.photoStepNew2: Prepare photos with exact matching filenames from your CSV
importExport.photoStepNew3: Create ZIP/RAR archive with all photos
importExport.photoStepNew4: Upload here - photos auto-match and upload immediately
importExport.documentStep1: Import members with personal_document field in CSV
importExport.documentStep2: Prepare documents with exact matching filenames
importExport.documentStep3: Create ZIP/RAR archive with all documents
importExport.documentStep4: Upload here - documents auto-match to members
importExport.resolveDuplicatesDesc: Choose which record should keep the phone number
importExport.duplicatePhoneWarning: Found {{count}} duplicate phone numbers. Please resolve conflicts.
importExport.blankPhoneOption: Both records will be imported without phone number
importExport.uploadPhotosWizardDesc: Upload photos to match with member records - this step is optional
importExport.uploadDocumentsWizardDesc: Upload documents to match with member records - this step is optional
importExport.photosWillBeMatched: Photos will be matched to members during import
importExport.documentsWillBeMatched: Documents will be matched to members during import
importExport.someFilesUnmatched: {{count}} files could not be matched to members
importExport.skipPhotoUpload: You can skip photo upload and add photos later
importExport.skipDocumentUpload: You can skip document upload and add documents later
importExport.createCustomFieldDesc: Define a custom field to import church-specific data
importExport.fieldNamePlaceholder: e.g., School Name, Ministry Interest, Emergency Contact
importExport.customFieldExample: Example: School Name, Ministry Interest, Emergency Contact
importExport.duplicatePhoneDesc: Phone numbers must be unique. Please fix the duplicates in your CSV file and upload again.
importExport.foundDuplicates: Found {{internal}} duplicate(s) within your file and {{external}} duplicate(s) with existing members in the database.
importExport.foundInternalDuplicates: Found {{count}} duplicate phone number(s) within your CSV file.
importExport.foundExternalDuplicates: Found {{count}} phone number(s) that already exist in the database.
importExport.fixDuplicatesInCSV: Edit your CSV file to remove or change duplicate phone numbers
importExport.reuploadFile: Upload the corrected file again and restart the import process

coa.title: Chart of Accounts
coa.subtitle: Manage church chart of accounts
coa.seedDefaultConfirm: This will create 53 default accounts for Indonesian churches. Continue?
coa.assetExplanation: Assets are resources owned by the church (Cash, Bank, Building, Land)
coa.liabilityExplanation: Liabilities are obligations or debts of the church (Accounts Payable, Loans)
coa.equityExplanation: Equity is the net worth of the church (Capital, Retained Earnings)
coa.incomeExplanation: Income is money received by the church (Offerings, Donations)
coa.expenseExplanation: Expenses are expenditures of the church (Salaries, Utilities, Maintenance)
coa.debitTooltip: Debit increases Assets & Expenses, decreases Income, Liabilities & Equity
coa.creditTooltip: Credit increases Income, Liabilities & Equity, decreases Assets & Expenses
coa.parentTooltip: Parent account to create hierarchy (e.g., Bank → Bank BCA)
coa.normalBalanceTooltip: Normal balance determines which side increases the account balance

journal.title: Journals
journal.subtitle: Manage general journals
journal.approveConfirm: Are you sure you want to approve this journal?
journal.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this journal?
journal.journalTooltip: A journal is a record of financial transactions using double-entry system
journal.mustBeBalanced: Total Debit must equal Total Credit
journal.minimumTwoLines: Journal must have at least 2 lines

fiscalPeriod.title: Fiscal Periods
fiscalPeriod.subtitle: Manage accounting periods
fiscalPeriod.closeConfirm: Close this period? Journals cannot be approved after closing.
fiscalPeriod.lockConfirm: Lock this period? Data cannot be changed after locking.
fiscalPeriod.periodTooltip: Fiscal periods control when data can be modified
fiscalPeriod.closeTooltip: Closing a period prevents new journal approvals
fiscalPeriod.lockTooltip: Locking a period makes data immutable
fiscalPeriod.lockExplanation: Locking periods ensures historical data cannot be changed, important for auditing and compliance.

quickEntry.title: Quick Entry
quickEntry.subtitle: Simplified entry forms
quickEntry.autoGenerateJournal: This form will automatically create a balanced journal

responsibilityCenter.title: Responsibility Centers
responsibilityCenter.subtitle: Manage ministries and projects
responsibilityCenter.name: Name
responsibilityCenter.tooltip: Responsibility Centers are used to track spending by ministry or project

budget.title: Budgets
budget.subtitle: Manage church budgets
budget.distributeTooltip: Divides annual amount evenly across 12 months
budget.activateTooltip: Budget must be validated before activation
budget.varianceTooltip: Difference between budgeted and actual spending

fixedAsset.title: Fixed Assets
fixedAsset.subtitle: Manage church fixed assets
fixedAsset.depreciationTooltip: Depreciation is the allocation of asset cost over its useful life
fixedAsset.salvageTooltip: Salvage value is the estimated value of the asset at end of useful life
fixedAsset.straightLineTooltip: Straight-line method: (Cost - Salvage Value) ÷ Useful Life
fixedAsset.runDepreciationConfirm: Run depreciation for all active assets for {{month}}/{{year}}?

bank.title: Bank Reconciliation
bank.subtitle: Manage bank accounts and reconciliation
bank.csvFormat: CSV Format: date, description, type, amount, balance
bank.reconciliationTooltip: Reconciliation is the process of matching bank transactions to journals

beginningBalance.title: Beginning Balance
beginningBalance.subtitle: Enter beginning balances for migration
beginningBalance.unbalancedMessage: Beginning balance is not balanced. Please review.
beginningBalance.unbalancedDetail: Total Debit ({{debit}}) must equal Total Credit ({{credit}})
beginningBalance.postConfirm: Post beginning balance? This will create an opening journal.
beginningBalance.beginningBalanceExplanation: Beginning balance is the account balance at the start of the accounting period, used for migration from old systems without entering all historical transactions.
beginningBalance.balancedExplanation: In double-entry accounting, total Debit must always equal total Credit to maintain the accounting equation: Assets = Liabilities + Equity

yearEnd.title: Year-End Closing
yearEnd.subtitle: Year-end closing process
yearEnd.allMonthsMustBeClosed: All 12 months must be closed or locked
yearEnd.closingConfirm: Close year {{year}}? This will create closing journal, update Retained Earnings, and lock all 12 months. This CANNOT BE UNDONE.
yearEnd.closingSummary: All 12 months of year {{year}} have been locked.
yearEnd.yearEndExplanation: Year-end closing is the process of closing all Income and Expense accounts (making them zero) and transferring Net Income to Retained Earnings account.
yearEnd.closingProcess: The system will create a closing journal that debits all Income accounts, credits all Expense accounts, and updates Retained Earnings with this year's Net Income.

reports.title: Reports
reports.subtitle: Church financial reports
reports.generalLedgerTooltip: General ledger shows all transactions by account
reports.trialBalanceTooltip: Trial balance verifies that total Debit equals total Credit
reports.incomeStatementTooltip: Income statement shows Income - Expenses = Net Income
reports.balanceSheetTooltip: Balance sheet shows financial position: Assets = Liabilities + Equity

auditLog.title: Audit Logs
auditLog.subtitle: Accounting change history
auditLog.auditTooltip: Audit logs record all accounting data changes for accountability

files.allowedFormats: Formats: JPG, PNG, PDF, Excel, CSV
files.dragDrop: Drag & drop file here or click to select

errors.JOURNAL_NOT_BALANCED: Journal is not balanced. Total Debit must equal Total Credit.
errors.ACCOUNT_CODE_EXISTS: Account code already exists. Use a different code.
errors.CANNOT_DELETE_USED_ACCOUNT: Cannot delete account that is used in journals.
errors.COA_EDIT_NOT_ALLOWED: Cannot modify account type, normal balance, or parent for accounts used in journals.
errors.PERIOD_LOCKED: This accounting period is locked. Cannot create or modify journals.
errors.PERIOD_CLOSED: This accounting period is closed. Journals cannot be approved.
errors.INVALID_PERIOD_OPERATION: Operation not allowed for this period.
errors.YEAR_ALREADY_CLOSED: This fiscal year is already closed. Cannot close again.
errors.CLOSING_FAILED: Year-end closing failed. Please try again or contact administrator.
errors.BUDGET_MONTHLY_ANNUAL_MISMATCH: Monthly total does not equal annual amount. Please review.
errors.CHURCH_ACCESS_DENIED: You do not have access to this church.
errors.TRANSACTION_FAILED: Database transaction failed. Please try again.
errors.VALIDATION_ERROR: Validation error. Please check your input.
errors.GENERIC_ERROR: An error occurred. Please try again.

validation.scheduleDraftOnly: Only draft articles can be scheduled
